title: Belgian "Liege" Waffles
description: These waffles are smaller and sweeter than normal waffles, and can be eaten on their own or with a topping of your choice.
directions: Microwave the milk in a 2 cup pyrex.
Sprinkle in the yeast and whisk
Allow the yeast to foam for 5-10 minutes
Meanwhile, combine salt and flour in a large bowl. Make a well in the center
Melt the butter in a 4 cup pyrex.
Add the eggs and vanilla to the butter. Whisk to combine.
Whisking constantly, add the yeast mixture to the butter.
Add the butter and yeast mixture to the flour well, mixing flour in slowly as you stream in the liquid. Dough should be fairly smooth
Proof at about 90 degrees F for around 30 minutes. Dough should double in size
Once proofed, fold in the pearl sugar.
Cook the dough, 1/4 cup scoop at a time, in a waffle iron set to medium heat for about 3 minutes. Waffles should reach a dark-ish golden brown color.
notes: This recipe will make your waffle iron very dirty
